article.title: Criticality of the random field Ising model in and out of equilibrium: a nonperturbative functional renormalization group description

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the black curve in Fig. 1 represent?
What causes the asymmetry in the finite-size scaling functions for hysteresis criticality shown in Fig. 2?
What physical quantity does the ratio of scaling functions ˜f(ϕ)/ˆf(ϕ)² in Fig. 3 correspond to?
choices: Dimensionless second cumulant of the renormalized random field

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the convergence of the anomalous dimensions ηk and ¯ηk in Fig. 4 indicate?
choices: Avalanches become irrelevant at large distance
Z2 symmetry is broken at the fixed point
Hysteresis and equilibrium fixed points are different

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the purpose of the finite-size scaling collapse represented by Formula (1)?
choices: To determine the location of the critical point
To obtain scaling functions that probe Z2 symmetry
To measure the size distribution of avalanches
